title: Installation issue: miniconda2 & miniconda3
body:
Miniconda2 and miniconda3 will always attempt to install v4.3.11 regardless of the version in the spec.  The problem stems from the install() function using self.url (which is hard-coded to the 4.3.11 version) instead of self.stage.archive_file.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install miniconda2 # any version other than 4.3.11 will trigger the issue
==> Installing miniconda2
==> Using cached archive: /home/xmr/git/spack/var/spack/cache/miniconda2/miniconda2-4.5.4.None
==> Already staged miniconda2-4.5.4-dyueiw7vx4rikzfqi4qxshnnmg2yrgu2 in /home/xmr/git/spack/var/spack/stage/miniconda2-4.5.4-dyueiw7vx4rikzfqi4qxshnnmg2yrgu2
==> No patches needed for miniconda2
==> Building miniconda2 [Package]
==> Executing phase: 'install'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 127:
    '/bin/bash' 'Miniconda2-4.3.11-Linux-x86_64.sh' '-b' '-f' '-p' '/home/xmr/git/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64/gcc-7.3.0/miniconda2-4.5.4-dyueiw7vx4rikzfqi4qxshnnmg2yrgu2'

1 error found in build log:
     1    ==> Executing phase: 'install'
     2    ==> '/bin/bash' 'Miniconda2-4.3.11-Linux-x86_64.sh' '-b' '-f' '-p' '/home/xmr/g
          it/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64/gcc-7.3.0/miniconda2-4.5.4-dyueiw7v
          x4rikzfqi4qxshnnmg2yrgu2'
  >> 3    /bin/bash: Miniconda2-4.3.11-Linux-x86_64.sh: No such file or directory

See build log for details:
  /home/xmr/git/spack/var/spack/stage/miniconda2-4.5.4-dyueiw7vx4rikzfqi4qxshnnmg2yrgu2/spack-build.out
```

Note in the error message that it couldn't find the Miniconda2-4.3.11-Linux-x86_64.sh file.  That's not the version that was requested and it's not the file that Spack downloads.

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux boo4 4.15.0-36-generic #39-Ubuntu SMP Mon Sep 24 16:19:09 UTC 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

$ lsb_release -d
Description:    Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS
``` 
### Additional information
Minor changes to the install() function to use ```self.stage.archive_file``` instead of ```self.url``` fix the issue. Pull request will be coming shortly.
